content.description: Climb to the obvious right facing, slanted crack with a bolt above.  Climb past the bouldery moves down low and up through easier terrain.
content.location:
Left of

Brewser

on the west face of the pillar.

content.description:
Mostly awkward movement up vertical to slightly overhanging plates, some of which are hollow. Moves distinctly right after the 2nd bolt onto vertical terrain and a shared juggy finish with

Dismembered

.

Rated 5.10a/b in the guidebook but it seems just a little harder than that.
content.location:
Left side of the east face and left of

Dismembered

.

content.description:
Climb vertical edges up to a bulge at the 2nd bolt (crux) which is quickly passed on good holds, rest if needed on the vertical face and then punch it up the overhanging finish on mostly incut jugs.

Short but fun and although rated 5.10b/c in the guidebook seems easier than the route just to the left which is rated easier.
content.location:
Right side of the east face and just right of

Rise and Devour

.

content.description: Located on the south face of the pillar, start in a small corridor on good holds to the first bolt.  Although not technically difficult for the grade, Brewser requires some thinking as the sequence is critical and not obvious.  Higher up, the climb is more slab than edges.  All in all, a good climb that never eases up too much.  Rappel to descend.
content.location:
On the south face, around and left from

Rise and Devour

.
